title: A Holistic Assessment of the Reliability of Machine Learning Systems. (arXiv:2307.10586v1 [cs.LG])
abstract: As machine learning (ML) systems increasingly permeate high-stakes settings such as healthcare, transportation, military, and national security, concerns regarding their reliability have emerged. Despite notable progress, the performance of these systems can significantly diminish due to adversarial attacks or environmental changes, leading to overconfident predictions, failures to detect input faults, and an inability to generalize in unexpected scenarios. This paper proposes a holistic assessment methodology for the reliability of ML systems. Our framework evaluates five key properties: in-distribution accuracy, distribution-shift robustness, adversarial robustness, calibration, and out-of-distribution detection. A reliability score is also introduced and used to assess the overall system reliability. translated_title: 机器学习系统可靠性的整体评估
translated_abstract: 随着机器学习系统越来越多地渗透到医疗保健、交通运输、军事和国家安全等高风险领域，人们对其可靠性产生了担忧。尽管取得了显著进展，但由于对抗攻击或环境变化，这些系统的性能可能显著降低，导致预测过于自信、无法检测输入故障以及在意外场景中无法泛化。本文提出了一种用于评估机器学习系统可靠性的整体评估方法。我们的框架评估了五个关键属性：分布内准确性、分布偏移鲁棒性、对抗鲁棒性、校准性和越界检测能力。我们还引入了一个可靠性得分来评估整个系统的可靠性。为了提供不同算法方法性能的见解，我们识别和分类了最先进的技术，然后使用真实世界的任务对其中的一些进行了评估。
tldr: 本文提出了一种用于评估机器学习系统可靠性的整体评估方法，通过评估分布内准确性、分布偏移鲁棒性、对抗鲁棒性、校准性和越界检测能力等五个关键属性，引入了可靠性得分来评估整个系统的可靠性。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes a holistic assessment methodology for evaluating the reliability of machine learning systems by evaluating five key properties: in-distribution accuracy, distribution-shift robustness, adversarial robustness, calibration, and out-of-distribution detection, and introducing a reliability score to assess the overall system reliability.
